noun.description: A strong feeling of annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
examples: the colonel's anger at his daughter's disobedience

verb.description: Fill (someone) with anger; provoke anger in.
examples: she was angered by his terse answer
he was angered that he had not been told
I was angered to receive a further letter from them

origin: Middle English: from Old Norse angr grief, angra vex. The original use was in the Old Norse senses; current senses date from late Middle English.
